entry.title: [CT] Limit bottom controls height for bottom bar
entry.content:
The maximum bottom bar height is 120dp. However, the bottom controls

were not limited by the bottom bar height. This could shrink the web contents height.



This CL ensures the bottom controls height is set based on the bottom

bar height instead of the child view.



Bug: 1434438

Change-Id: Ia36a8b3b222bf169ac5bda0740c735466244eeb4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4606514

entry.title: Avoid dangling ptr warning in VirtualCardEnrollmentManagerTest
entry.content:
Do not bind a soon to go out-of-scope local variable to a long-lived

global singleton. Instead, swap out the Resource Bundle as is done

in other tests, and adjust the declaration of its delegate so as

to live for the appropriate time.



-- Convert to NiceMock to avoid some noise in test log while at it.



Bug: 1401495

Change-Id: I2b2e03c2a4819bf5e161d84e804adb14148be1a3

entry.title: shortcuts: Fix sorting bug in edit-dialog.
entry.content:
* Problem: Clicking 'restore default' will change default ordering of

accelerators.



* Reason: 'restore default' will trigger an update event, and the

updated_accel is not sorted or filtered.



* Fix: Follow the pattern in accelerator_subsection, filter the

accelerators in the update() function, sort and display the

accelerators using getSortedAccelerators().



* unit tests are updated.



Bug: b/216049298

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter=ShortcutCustomizationApp*

entry.title: [omnibox] Makes sure OmniboxResultView at an index is present before use
entry.content:
It is possible for the Omnibox model and popup view to be out of sync.

For instance the model might think the popup is open while it is in fact

closed.



Currently when the model informs the popup view to update a match icon,

the popup view assumes an OmniboxResultView is present at that index

and calls OmniboxResultView::OnMatchIconUpdated(). This is a likely

culprit for the crash seen in crbug.com/1449689 and a few other

related bugs.



The popup view does already nullptr check the result view in some

places, this CL extends that to everywhere `result_view_at(index)`

is called. This however does not fix the route cause as to why the

model and the view are out of sync, e.g., why the popup is closed

while the model thinks otherwise.



Bug: 1449689

Change-Id: Ia7d810cf4b2fe1cdfc614bf0c46e1de973f33cc6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4606315

Code-Coverage: Findit

entry.title: Reland "[Extensions] Enable tabCapture with workers and offscreen documents"
entry.content:
This reverts commit eec0a288408ac1ba1271c952718ccfb670614690.



Reason for revert: the original change was reverted due to an

unrelated error; see comments for more details.



Original change's description:

> Revert "[Extensions] Enable tabCapture with workers and offscreen documents"

>

> This reverts commit 3302a41972d9b5a278901a4b745e1df2ad9e7b10.

>

> Reason for revert: OffscreenApiTest.TabCaptureStreams is very flaky on Windows CI, see crbug/1453212.

>

> Original change's description:

> > [Extensions] Enable tabCapture with workers and offscreen documents

> >

> > MediaStreams are unavailable in ServiceWorker contexts. This means

> > the tabCapture API doesn't work in Manifest V3 background contexts

> > (since these are service worker-based). The primary alternative to

> > functionality that's tied to a DOM or Window context is to use

> > offscreen documents; however, these (by design) do not have access

> > to extension APIs, which means they can't access the tabCapture API.

> > This effectively means there's no good way to use the tabCapture

> > API in a background context in Manifest V3.

> >

> > Fix this by:

> > - Allowing service worker contexts to use

> > `tabCapture.getMediaStreamId()`. This returns an ID that can

> > later be used to fetch a media stream, rather than returning the

> > MediaStream object itself. As such, it's (conceptually)

> > compatible with service worker contexts.

> > - Allowing offscreen documents to use the media stream ID to

> > start capture via the navigator.getUserMedia() API (which is

> > what tabCapture.capture() already used).

> >

> > In practice, this entails allowing extension contexts to use a

> > media stream generated by another context *on the same origin*, rather

> > than restricting it to the same frame that created the stream ID.

> > (This isn't a change in security or privacy, since the extension could

> > already pass any of this information between its own contexts.)

> > Additionally, update `tabCapture.getMediaStreamId()`'s implementation

> > to not rely on the presence of a RenderFrame.

> >

> > Add an end-to-end test using offscreen documents to capture the

> > stream of an active tab.

> >

> > Bug: 1400269

> > Change-Id: I1e0f0a46d098e56357881ed64dfd249b6b692936

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4514180

> > Reviewed-by: James Cook

> > Reviewed-by: Mark Foltz

> > Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

> > Reviewed-by: Elad Alon

> > Commit-Queue: Devlin Cronin

> > Reviewed-by: Tim

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1154676}

>

entry.title: cros_next: fix desk button focus ring insets
entry.content:
The focus rings of save desk buttons have larger outsets. This is

because they are using StyleUtil::SetUpFocusRingForView which

assign the outsets to the halo insets of the focus ring. However,

PillButton has a highlight path generator which already includes the

outsets. The halo insets will be added on the path again.



This cl fixes it by removing setting the focus ring by

StyleUtil::SetUpFocusRingForView.



The screenshot after fixing is attached in the bug comments.



Bug: b:286457023

entry.title: Reland "Reland "pthreadpool: Integrate with Jobs API""
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 9fd417a399dfb28ace5add2fa7df714f70de5bb6



The pthreadpoool library is built with "sanitizers:cfi_icall_disable"

config that would cause pthreadpool_unittests failure on the Linux CFI

bot, such as [1]. This reland enables the cfi-icall sanitizer flag by

removing this config. It also fixes a pointer cast issue in

pthreadpool_unittests.



[1]: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20CFI/25348/overview



Original change's description:

> Reland "pthreadpool: Integrate with Jobs API"

>

> This is a reland of commit e29465230b2f97fc64d51395bf9353e2ab266570

>

> This reland fixes the build issue on win-arm64 bots, such as [1], by

> declaring the missing arm64 intrinsics if the arm64intr.h is not

> included correctly due to LLVM issue [2]. Once the LLVM issue is

> resolved, this work-around should be removed.

>

> [1]: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8779781271284246545

> [2]: https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/62942

>

> Original change's description:

> > pthreadpool: Integrate with Jobs API

> >

> > pthreadpool is used by XNNPACK which in turns supports TFLite and WebNN

> > to execute each neural network operator of a model by multiple threads

> > in parallel.

> >

> > To avoid creating an unmanaged thread pool owned by pthreadpool

> > implementation, this CL implements a shim of `pthreadpool_parallelize()`

> > that maps the pthreadpool thread tasks to work items and uses Jobs API

> > (`base::PostJob`) to schedule these work items with Chromium's

> > `base::ThreadPool` workers.

> >

> > According to the test result on a multi-core device, when scheduling 4

> > work items with `base::ThreadPool`, XNNPACK model inference performance

> > could get ~1.9X speedup for MobileNet V2 and ~2.8X speedup for ResNet50

> > V2 compared to single thread execution. And the test result also shows

> > using Jobs API shim could achieve 85% and 97% performance of using

> > pthreadpool own thread pool implementation for MobileNet V2 and ResNet50

> > V2 respectively.

> >

> > This CL also enables pthreadpool_unittests with Jobs API integration on

> > Windows and Linux bots that aligns with the `build_tflite_with_xnnpack`

> > build flag.

> >

> >

> > Bug: 1228275,1273291

> > Change-Id: I1152d1e93885399b453c87be18a432e6c118054e

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4467727

entry.title: Fix dangling ptrs in CreditCardAccessManager
entry.content:
`selected_challenge_option_` points to an element in an array

that is part of `virtual_card_unmask_response_details_`. Hence

any assignment to `virtual_card_unmask_response_details_` may

invalidate that pointer, so null it first to guard against

accidental use in the future.



The dangling ptr bots on the CQ don't always catch this because

these are copy-assignments and the vector may be left using the

same backing store, just resized, potentially smaller. In which

case we'll have a container overflow detected under the GN arg

use_asan_unowned_ptr=true when the CCAM is destructed.



Fix local ordering in tests so that credit card outlives the OTP

authentication response. One way to enforce this at compile time

is to pass a temporary and chain together the .with_*() methods,

which also seems more elegant.



Bug: 1401495

Change-Id: Ibcb0cc3a85d2ed7d75b49bbd3dafc8bc4912d484

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4604926

entry.title: Report false for canChangeType when MediaFoundationRenderer in use
entry.content:
Codec Switching support is currently being worked on for

MediaFoundationRenderer. Report false for the canChangeType

web API until the feature is complete. The web API routes

down to ChunkDemuxer::CanChangeType.



I tested this change by playing videos with and without

Media Foundation for Clear enabled. I confirmed that this method was

returning false when Media Foundation for Clear was enabled and the

method was unaffected when Media Foundation for Clear was not enabled.



This change is a temporary fix while we add support for

Media Foundation Codec Switching. This is tracked in crbug.com/1426179

The mediasource-changetype.html web test is also disabled for the

MF Virtual Test Suite temporarily while canChangeType support is added.

entry.title: [Views] always repaint and re-lay-out after mirroring a bubble
entry.content:
The current logic was repainting only when the arrow or offset differed

from the original setting rather than when it actually changed. This

resulted in unnecessary repaits and also missing repaints in some cases

when a bubble was mirrored back to its original position.



This in turn caused visible anchor arrows (as used in help bubbles) to

not repaint in the correct position. (It may also cause other more

subtle rendering bugs.)

entry.title: [NP] Use BluetoothDevice ServiceDataMap for UUIDs.
entry.content:
Bluez only populates the UUIDs of discovered BLE advertisements

in its service data map -- not in its UUID list (b/285637726).

Until b/285637726 is understood, adjust the Nearby BleV2Medium to

rely on the service data map, rather than the UUID list, to

understand which UUIDs are on a BLE advertisement.

entry.title: Move WebContentsObserver destruction earlier in ~ExtensionFunction()
entry.content:
We've been seeing browser hangs on ChromeOS in ~WebContentsObserver()

called from ~ExtensionFunction(). Move the WebContentsObserver

destruction slightly earlier in ~ExtensionFunction() so that the

extension function crash keys can potentially capture the ID of the

extension triggering the hang.



Bug: 1435545

entry.title: [omnibox] Fix Omnibox.TypingDuration not recorded for realbox
entry.content:
This CL informs the edit model about text input so that it will track

input time and record it in the OmniboxLog on commit. This gets

the Omnibox.TypingDuration metric working as it does in the omnibox.



Note, directly calling SetInputInProgress was not sufficient because

there are some conditions around the edit model input state that would

invalidate the time recording if not driven by SetUserText.



This CL also fixes a bug where neither the omnibox nor realbox would

record the input time if the popup was closed. There was a DCHECK

that could fail in either case but would've certainly failed for

realbox.



Bug: 1453382

entry.title: [DataRetentionPolicies] Adding known sync types check
entry.content:
Currently, we rely on the static assert for sync types enum size to

confirm that we cover all the sync types required to be disabled for

clearing browsing data for data deletion policies.



To make this more resilient to changes, as per security

recommendations, this CL adds a set of known sync types to be

checked when a data deletion policy is set.

entry.title: Fix Mac FullscreenController `windowed_frame_` bookkeeping
entry.content:
Set `windowed_frame_` when entering fullscreen from windowed state.

Do not reset `windowed_frame_` in case it is needed to restore again.



Fixes calls to EnterFullscreen(fooDisplay) while restoring the frame.

- `windowed_frame_` was being reset, but not re-cached in transition

- the next fullscreen exit attempted to use the errantly reset value



Bug: 1449330

entry.title: Fix styling for DialogWhenLarge
entry.content:
The DialogWhenLarge material theme switches to a fixed size dialog for "large" window sizes (i.e. using values-large/). Previously Theme.Chromium.DialogWhenLarge's background resource was overriden in sw600dp. Move it to values-large/ so rounded corners are applied for when smallest width is < 600dp and the window is 'large'.



Before: https://hsv.googleplex.com/6146109689823232

After: https://hsv.googleplex.com/5890431326879744



Fixed: 1450412, b/285438559

element, to avoid bugs such as noopener not being set on new window when

new spec[1].

entry.title: [aw][tracing] Add trace events for API calls
entry.content:
This change adds trace events for WebView-related API calls with the

following naming patterns:



- WebView.APICall.Framework.* - methods of Android WebView and related

classes (WebSettings, CookieManager etc);

- WebView.APICall.AndroidX.* - AndroidX methods;

- WebView.APICallback.* - places where WebView runs client callbacks.



Trace events were added where these API calls were already reported

as UMA histograms, so the coverage is not exhaustive (but still

extensive).



For consistency, existing 'WebViewContentsClientAdapter.*' trace events

have been renamed to 'WebView.APICallback.WebViewClient.*' and

converted to scoped events.



API method names are passed as strings in this first iteration, but the

long-term approach would be to use enums (this will require adding Java

infrastructure) as part of b/286245742.





Bug: b/266585189

Binary-Size: Increase is temporary (see above about enums for APIs).

Low-Coverage-Reason: No new functional code, just reformatting.

Change-Id: I839fd547aceb1e800be0be60a7b46f7e7e637baf

entry.title: [Privacy Sandbox] Create privacy sandbox attestations component
entry.content:
installer policy.



Implement PrivacySandboxAttestationsComponentInstallerPolicy and its

registration to the component updater.



This component is gated on feature kEnforcePrivacySandboxAttestations.

If the feature is disabled, this component will not be registered.



This component will receive a proto attestations list. The list will

be parsed and loaded into an in-memory map, which is used to check if

the Privacy Sandbox API is enrolled or not.



To be implemented in next few CLs:



1. The loading (opening the file, invoke the parser, maintaining the

parsing status, and store the result back to the handler) of the

attestations list will be implemented in class PrivacySandboxAttestationsLoader.



2. The parsing of the attestations list will be implemented in

class PrivacySandboxAttestationsParser.



3. The class PrivacySandboxAttestationsHandler is a global singleton

that holds the attestations data. All queries on API enrollment status

will be directed to the Handler.



Related CL: crrev.com/c/4480525

Public blog:

https://developer.chrome.com/blog/announce-enrollment-privacy-sandbox/



Change-Id: I3fba325b51386a0830846d8bde051749bd4d0136

entry.title: [anchor-position] Parse and evaluator `auto` and `auto-size` keywords
entry.content:
This patch adds two more anchor side keywords `auto` and `auto-size`

to the `anchor()` function, and evaluates them by converting them into

the corresponding physical sides.



This patch doesn't implement the automatic fallbacks, which will be

implemented by a follow-up patch.

entry.title: Reland "Handle nodeless break opportunities in AXPosition::FromPosition"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 62bb11dfc61d7b9af789ffa6d3c4feca8dcfca81

with the following changes made:



* Fix the regression (see crbug.com/1450024), which was caused by the

incorrect assumption that the units associated with the mapping

would be for content inside the accessible container's node. That

node's units can be a subset of the mapping units.

* Also ignore the isolate characters which can be inserted during

layout (e.g. in SVG text elements with a list of x coordinates)

* Rename AXPosition::AdjustContentOffsetForNonContiguousMappings

to AXPosition::GetLeadingIgnoredCharacterCount which better

reflects the new logic.



Original change's description:

> Handle nodeless break opportunities in AXPosition::FromPosition

>

> The accessible text exposed to assistive technologies comes from the

> InlineTextBox content; characters representing break opportunities are

> excluded.

>

> If the break opportunity has an associated node, such as ,

> AXPosition is able to connect that character's content offsets

> with the "ignored" accessibility object, and ensure the text offsets

> exposed to ATs correspond to the accessible text. It needs to do the

> same for break opportunities which lack an associated node, such as

> those inserted at the end of preserved leading spaces.

>

> Create AXPosition::AdjustContentOffsetForNonContiguousMappings which

> identifies nodeless break opportunities and adjusts the accessible

> content offset accordingly.

>

> AX-Relnotes: Screen readers should no longer present the wrong character

> during caret navigation if "white-space: pre-wrap" is applied to an

> element with leading spaces.

>

> Bug: 1442835

> Change-Id: I914d051b942dcd50de55674816e32cfbf578e5a6

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4543184

> Reviewed-by: Koji Ishii

> Commit-Queue: Joanmarie Diggs

> Reviewed-by: Benjamin Beaudry

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1150216}



Bug: 1442835, 1449655

entry.title: PartnerBrowserCustomizations#initializeAsync one at a time
entry.content:
Prevent starting another #initializeAsync when one is still in progress. This CL 1) fixed cases where any of the mInitializeAsyncCallbacks tries to read #isInitialized, and 2) make those case more resource efficient so we are not running same tasks within short period of time.



To understand the impact, the described situation can happen when receiving a VIEW intent.

entry.title: Use RasterContextProvider for cc compositor
entry.content:
We eventually want to switch the cc compositor context to use the raster

decoder instead of GLES2 decoder. To prepare for that cc needs to stop

using GLES2Interface entirely. Switch the compositor context to be a

RasterContextProvider so it can provide both GLES2Interface and

RasterInterface.



This is mostly just changing the type as RasterContextProvider offers

all the same functionality as ContextProvider and

ContextProviderCommandBuffer implements both interfaces. There are two

places, one for Android UI compositor and the other for WebView, where

GLES2 contexts need to have |enable_raster_interface| set true so cc

compositor context always has RasterInterface available. Some tests also

need to be updated to GLES + raster contexts.



Bug: 1453349

Change-Id: Ifdff4e58ca61216d03208522c0aafb4c39a9a9d1

entry.title: Use crop or blend to handle AlphaThreshold filters
entry.content:
Follow-up change that replaces the direct use of SkImageFilters::AlphaThreshold

with an equivalent image filter (given the use of 0 for both thresholds)

that relies on a src-in blend with the region, or just a crop when the

region is a simple rect.
